summary:
• The Taliban's takeover led to the forced disappearance of many female activists and journalists.
• Some were killed or executed publicly while others remained in hiding due to fear of persecution.
• Many have gone into exile, with some receiving international protection and support.

• Scientists used drones to film whales in Antarctica performing acrobatic stunts.
• The footage showed the whales jumping high out of the water and doing flips.
• The study aims to learn more about these intelligent creatures and their behavior.

• Argentina's national football team has won the World Cup championship title.
• The country is experiencing economic instability due to high inflation rates and currency devaluation.
• There have been protests against government policies, with citizens demanding change.

• Underwater video shows possible 1971 plane wreckage.
• Woman runs 1,000 km in 12 days; feels "broken".
• No other information is provided.

• A US Embassy worker has been accused of sexually assaulting girls at their home in Burkina Faso.
• The allegations have sparked outrage among locals and foreigners alike.
• Authorities are investigating the incident to determine the extent of the abuse and bring those responsible to justice.

• The article discusses advancements in wearable health technology, specifically focusing on blood sugar monitoring devices.
• A research team in Canada has discovered the wreckage of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship, which sank during an Antarctic expedition.

• A prominent Chinese journalist and activist has been arrested and detained
• The arrest is part of a broader crackdown on civil society in China
• The incident highlights the ongoing struggle for press freedom in the country

• Cuban government extends welcome to Russian military ships in Havana
• Ships will dock at Havana's main port for refueling and maintenance
• Move seen as strengthening ties between countries

• A museum in France has removed two famous artworks due to concerns that they may have been stolen by Nazis during World War II.
• Protesters in France are speaking out against a perceived shift towards the right wing ahead of a planned election.
• The country is facing uncertainty and division as it prepares for a new leader.

• 800 people flee a Mediterranean village due to unknown reasons.
• Tourist safety is emphasized on Greek islands amid hot weather.

• Susannah's grandfather was in charge of Bengal during the famine that caused millions of deaths.
• The grandmother of an author may face trial under an anti-terrorism law.

• Iran and Sweden exchange prisoners in a deal
• One of the exchanged prisoners is a convicted war criminal
• The prisoner swap aims to improve bilateral relations between the two nations

• A massive fire broke out at an oil refinery in Iraq.
• The cause of the blaze remains unknown.
• Emergency responders are working to contain the spread of the fire.

• Eight Israeli soldiers were killed during an operation in Rafah.
• The incident occurred while Gaza residents prepared to celebrate Eid al-Fitr.
• This tragic event has significant implications for regional tensions.

- Hundreds flee Mediterranean village due to natural disaster.
- Italian leader downplays international controversy over reproductive rights.
- Leader reassures public amid global disagreements on sensitive issue.

• A Kenyan farmer has become a leading advocate for climate change denial.
• A Kenyan magistrate was fatally shot by a police officer.
• No other information is provided.

• US provides key intelligence support to Israel in hostage rescue efforts.
• This partnership helps Israeli forces locate and free hostages from captivity.
• The cooperation between the two nations aims to enhance regional security and safety.

• Philippines increases pressure on China over South China Sea dispute.
• The country faces significant opposition from China in the region.
• Tensions escalate between the two nations due to conflicting territorial claims.

• Cyril Ramaphosa has been re-elected as the President of South Africa
• This is his second term in office after being elected in 2018
• The election was held on May 7, 2021, and saw Ramaphosa win with over 50% of the votes

• Millions in Sudan face daily struggles finding food due to ongoing conflict.
• The United Nations urges an end to the siege of Darfur city amidst the country's civil war.
• Conflict-ridden regions like Darfur experience severe food shortages.

• An Iranian national was released from prison after being extradited to Iran as part of a prisoner exchange agreement between Iran and Sweden.
• The individual had been detained by Swedish authorities on charges related to war crimes committed during the Iran-Iraq War.
• This development marks a significant diplomatic effort to resolve long-standing tensions between the two nations.

• Switzerland is a small country in the midst of global crises
• It plays a significant role in international diplomacy and humanitarian efforts
• Its neutral stance allows it to facilitate dialogue between conflicting parties

• New research suggests that animals may be conscious beings.
• A group of people were accidentally suspended upside-down on an amusement park ride.
• Former hostage has been reunited with their family through miraculous means.
• Popular television program will end after only two seasons.
• Upcoming US presidential election will likely be decided in six specific states.
• Development of wearable technology could revolutionize diabetes management.
• US President Joe Biden met with Pope Francis during a summit focused on supporting Ukraine.

• Zelensky seeks show of support at giant Ukraine peace summit
• Putin's peace terms rejected by Ukraine
• Russia rejects Ukraine's peace proposal
